member.summary: Read the first-hits file and create a new, parallel file with the MSGF results

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFInputCreator.CreateMSGFInputFileUsingPHRPResultFiles
member.summary: Creates the input file for MSGF Will contain filter passing peptides from the synopsis file, plus all peptides in the first-hits file that are not filter passing in the synopsis file If the synopsis file does not exist, then simply processes the first-hits file

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFInputCreator.LookupColumnValue(System.String[]@,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.SortedDictionary{System.String,System.Int32}@)
member.summary: Returns the string stored in the given named column (using objColumnHeaders to dereference column name with column index)
member.returns: The text in the specified column; an empty string if the specific column name is not recognized

member.returns: The text in the specified column; strValueIfMissing if the specific column name is not recognized

member.summary: Updates the column name to column index mapping in objColumnHeaders
member.param: Column names read from the input file
Column mapping dictionary object to update
member.remarks: The SortedDictionary object should be instantiated using a case-insensitive comparer, i.e. (StringComparer.CurrentCultureIgnoreCase)

member.summary: Runs MSGF

member.summary: Examines the Sequest, X!Tandem, or Inspect param file to determine if ETD mode is enabled
member.returns: True if success; false if an error

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.CheckETDModeEnabledSequest(System.String)
member.summary: Examines the Sequest param file to determine if ETD mode is enabled If it is, then sets mETDMode to True
member.returns: True if success; false if an error

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.CheckETDModeEnabledXTandem(System.String)
member.summary: Examines the X!Tndem param file to determine if ETD mode is enabled If it is, then sets mETDMode to True
member.param: X!Tandem XML parameter file to read
member.returns: True if success; false if an error

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.CreateMSGFInputFile(AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.ePeptideHitResultType,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Creates the MSGF Input file by reading Sequest, X!Tandem, or Inspect PHRP result file and extracting the relevant information Uses the ModSummary.txt file to determine the dynamic and static mods used

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.CreateMZXMLFile(System.String)
member.summary: Generate the mzXML
member.returns: True if success; false if an error

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.PostProcessMSGFResults(AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.ePeptideHitResultType,System.String)
member.summary: Post-process the MSGF output file to create two new MSGF result files, one for the synopsis file and one for the first-hits file Will also look for non-numeric values in the SpecProb column Examples: N/A: unrecognizable annotation N/A: precursor mass != peptide mass (4089.068 vs 4078.069) the new MSGF result files will guarantee that the SpecProb column has a number, but will have an additional column called SpecProbNotes with any notes or warnings The synopsis-based MSGF results will be extended to include any entries skipped when creating the MSGF input file (to aid in linking up files later)
member.returns: True if success; false if one or more errors

member.name: M:AnalysisManagerMSGFPlugin.clsMSGFRunner.ReadModSummaryFile(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.SortedDictionary{System.String,System.String}@,System.Collections.Generic.SortedDictionary{System.String,System.String}@)
member.summary: Reads the data in strModSummaryFilePath. Populates objDynamicMods and objStaticMods with the modification definitions
member.param: Path to the PHRP Mod Summary file to read
List with mod symbols as the key and the corresponding mod mass
List with amino acid names as the key and the corresponding mod mass
member.returns: True if success; false if an error
